alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 3:31PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Lake and central Missoula Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 331 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Frenchtown, or 15 miles northwest of Missoula, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Half-inch size hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Wye, Evaro, Frenchtown, Arlee, Ninemile and Huson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 80 and 101. Highway 93 N between mile markers 0 and 13, and between mile markers 15 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
